com.pb.sawdust.io

Class ZipFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.io.ZipFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>

    public class ZipFile
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>
    The ZipFile class provides a convenience class for dealing with zip files.

    For writing/modifying zip files, the various add methods and deleteEntry(String) methods are used. These only queue changes to the zip file; the changes are only written to disk when the write() method is called.

    For reading zip files, the various extract methods are used. It is important to note that extracting data only works from for the data on disk; if changes to the zip file have been queued but not written the extract methods will not be able to access these changes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ZipFile.CompositeZipEntrySource
      The CompositeZipEntrySource provides a zip entry source made from a series of ZipEntrySources.
      static class  ZipFile.FileZipEntrySource
      The FileZipEntrySource provides a simple zip entry source which reads its data from a file.
      static interface  ZipFile.ZipEntrySource
      The ZipEntrySource provides a framework for sending data into a zip file entry.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ZipFile

        public ZipFile(java.io.File zipFile,
       boolean replace)
        Constructor specifying the zip file and whether it should be replaced or appended to.
        Parameters:
        zipFile - The zip file. It does not need to exist.
        replace - If true then the zip file will be replaced, otherwise it will be appended to. If zipFile doesn't exist, then this parameter has no effect.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if zipFile exists and is not a file.

    • Method Detail

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(java.lang.String name,
            ZipFile.ZipEntrySource source)
        Add an entry to this zip file. If the entry name contains directories (denoted by "/" characters) then those directories will be recursively added (as needed) as directory entries.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the entry.
        source - The source for accessing the entry data.

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String data,
            java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Add an entry containing string data to the zip file. If the entry name contains directories (denoted by "/" characters) then those directories will be recursively added (as needed) as directory entries.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the entry.
        data - The data the entry will hold.
        charset - The character set that data will be encoded in.

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String data)
        Add an entry containing string data to the zip file using default character encoding. If the entry name contains directories (denoted by "/" characters) then those directories will be recursively added (as needed) as directory entries.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the entry.
        data - The data the entry will hold.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the entry.
        data - The data the entry will hold.

      • addDirectoryByName

        public void addDirectoryByName(java.lang.String name)
        Add a directory entry to the zip file. If the entry name contains sub-directories (denoted by "/" characters) then those directories will be recursively added (as needed) as directory entries.
        Parameters:
        name - The (directory) name of the entry.

      • addFile

        public void addFile(java.io.File file,
           java.io.File basePath)
        Add an existing file to the zip file. All of the directories in the file will be recursively added, as needed, as directory entries. The base path will be used to resolve the file location, but none of its directories will be added or used in the the zip file entries.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to add to the zip file (this should be relative, including only those directories which also are to be included in the zip file).
        basePath - The base path of the file. The file location should be representable by new File(basePath,file.getPath()).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file does not exists.

      • addFile

        public void addFile(java.lang.String file,
           java.lang.String basePath)
        Add an existing file to the zip file. All of the directories in the file will be recursively added, as needed, as directory entries. The base path will be used to resolve the file location, but none of its directories will be added or used in the the zip file entries.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to add to the zip file (this should be relative, including only those directories which also are to be included in the zip file).
        basePath - The base path of the file. The file location should be representable by new File(basePath,file).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file does not exists.

      • addFile

        public void addFile(java.io.File file)
        Convenience method for adding a file to a zip file. This method will exclude all directories from being added to the zip file; the zip entry name will be just file.getName().
        Parameters:
        file - The file to add to the zip file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file does not exists.

      • addFile

        public void addFile(java.lang.String file)
        Convenience method for adding a file to a zip file. This method will exclude all directories from being added to the zip file; the zip entry name will be just new File(file).getName().
        Parameters:
        file - The file to add to the zip file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file does not exists.

      • addFileInDirectory

        public void addFileInDirectory(java.io.File file,
                      java.io.File directory)
        Add a file to a zip file with an entry indicating a different file path. That is, the entry will use the combination of directory and file.getname() for its name, but file for its data. The directories specified by directory will be added recursively, as needed, as directory entries.
        Parameters:
        file - The file whose data will be added to the entry.
        directory - The directory within which the file will be placed in the zip file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file does not exists.

      • addFileInDirectory

        public void addFileInDirectory(java.lang.String file,
                      java.lang.String directory)
        Add a file to this zip file with an entry indicating a different file path. That is, the entry will use the combination of directory and new File(file).getname() for its name, but file for its data. The directories specified by directory will be added recursively, as needed, as directory entries.
        Parameters:
        file - The file whose data will be added to the entry.
        directory - The directory within which the file will be placed in the zip file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file does not exists.

      • addDirectory

        public void addDirectory(java.io.File directory,
                java.io.File basePath,
                java.io.FileFilter filter)
        Add an entire directory tree to this zip file. All sub-files/directories not excluded by the filter will be added. All sub-directories in directory will be recursively added, as needed, as directory entries. The base path is used to resolve the absolute path of the starting directory, but will not be used when naming the zip entries. To add a directory that does not exist, use addDirectoryByName(String).
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to add.
        basePath - The base path of the directory. The directory location should be representable by new File(basePath,directory.getPath()).
        filter - The filter used to exclude entries from the zip file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if directory does not exists, or is not a directory.

      • addDirectory

        public void addDirectory(java.lang.String directory,
                java.lang.String basePath,
                java.io.FileFilter filter)
        Add an entire directory tree to this zip file. All sub-files/directories not excluded by the filter will be added. All sub-directories in directory will be recursively added, as needed, as directory entries. The base path is used to resolve the absolute path of the starting directory, but will not be used when naming the zip entries. To add a directory that does not exist, use addDirectoryByName(String).
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to add.
        basePath - The base path of the directory. The directory location should be representable by new File(basePath,directory).
        filter - The filter used to exclude entries from the zip file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if directory does not exists, or is not a directory.

The base path is used to resolve the absolute path of the starting directory, but will not be used when naming the zip entries. To add a directory that does not exist, use addDirectoryByName(String).
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to add.
        basePath - The base path of the directory. The directory location should be representable by new File(basePath,directory.getPath()).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if directory does not exists, or is not a directory.

      • addDirectory

The base path is used to resolve the absolute path of the starting directory, but will not be used when naming the zip entries. To add a directory that does not exist, use addDirectoryByName(String).

      • deleteEntry

        public void deleteEntry(java.lang.String name)
        Delete an entry from the zip file.
        Parameters:
        name - The entry to delete.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if entry is not in the zip file (as it exists in this class, not necessarily on disk).

      • getEntryList

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getEntryList()
        Get the entries in this zip file. The entries will be listed as the zip file exists in this instance, not necessarily on disk (the file on disk will not reflect this instance until the write() method is called. The returned map will have a seperate key-value pair for files and directories, using the LIST_FILE_KEY and LIST_DIRECTORY_KEY respectively.
        Returns:
        a map containing the entries of this zip file.

      • write

        public void write()
        Write the zip file to disk. If the zip file already exists, then this method will write a temporary file, then replace the original (so that the original is not lost if there is an error writing). It is important to note that once this method is called, this ZipFile instance will be placed into "append" mode, even if it was constructed in "replace" mode. To replace the zip file, a replacement instance must be instantiated.

      • extract

        public void extract(java.lang.String entry,
           java.io.File location)
        Extract an entry from this zip file to disk. If the entry has directories (denoted by "/" characters), then they will be created before extracting the file, even if they are not explicitly listed in the zip file as directory entries.
        Parameters:
        entry - The entry to extract.
        location - The location to extract the entry to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if entry is not found in this zip file.

      • extract

        Parameters:

        location - The location to extract the entry to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if entry is not found in this zip file.

      • extractDirectory

        public void extractDirectory(java.lang.String directoryEntry,
                    java.io.File location)
        Extract a directory and all of its contents from this zip file to disk. That is, all entries starting with directoryEntry will be extracted. If no entries start with directoryEntry, then this method will (effectively) do nothing.
        Parameters:
        directoryEntry - The directory (entry) whose contents will be extracted.
        location - The location to extract the entries to.

      • extractDirectory

        public void extractDirectory(java.lang.String directoryEntry,
                    java.lang.String location)
        Extract a directory and all of its contents from this zip file to disk. That is, all entries starting with directoryEntry will be extracted. If no entries start with directoryEntry, then this method will (effectively) do nothing.
        Parameters:
        directoryEntry - The directory (entry) whose contents will be extracted.
        location - The location to extract the entries to.

      • extract

        public void extract(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> entries,
           java.io.File location)
        Extract a number of entries from this zip file to disk. If any of the entries has directories (denoted by "/" characters), then they will be created before extracting the file, even if they are not explicitly listed in the zip file as directory entries.
        Parameters:
        entries - The entries to extract.
        location - The location to extract the entries to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any entry in entries is not found in this zip file.

      • extract

        public void extract(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> entries,
           java.lang.String location)
        Extract a number of entries from this zip file to disk. If any of the entries has directories (denoted by "/" characters), then they will be created before extracting the file, even if they are not explicitly listed in the zip file as directory entries.
        Parameters:
        entries - The entries to extract.
        location - The location to extract the entries to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any entry in entries is not found in this zip file.

        public void extract(java.lang.String entry,

        Parameters:

        os - The output stream to extract the entry to.

                             java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Extract the data in an entry to a string with a specified character encoding.
        Parameters:

        charset - The character encoding to use when converting the data to a string.
        Returns:

      • extractString

        public java.lang.String extractString(java.lang.String entry)
        Extract the data in an entry to a string with the default character encoding.
        Parameters:
        entry - The entry to extract.
        Returns:
        a string containing the extracted data for entry.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if entry is not found in this zip file.

      • getInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.lang.String entry)
        Get an input stream to read the data from an entry in this zip file. The data read from this input stream will be extracted (uncompressed). The returned input must be closed when finished to release the opened connection to the zip file.
        Parameters:
        entry - The entry to get the input stream for.
        Returns:
        an input stream for reading the uncompressed data for entry.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if entry is not found in this zip file.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> iterator()
        Get iterator for iterating over the names of the entries in this zip file. The entries will be ordered such that the directories will be listed first, then the file. The entry names will be as they exist in this instance, not necessarily how they exist on disk.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>
        Returns:
        an iterator for the entry names in this zip file.
